intro: Ruschia calcarea, commonly known as the rock Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and arid landscapes.
